PIC Code/EOL.c

00001 ///@file EOL.c
00002 ///@brief End Of Line detection, hardware interface
00003 #include "TCPIP Stack/TCPIP.h"
00004 #include "SecuritySystem.h"
00005 #include "xPL.h"
00006 
00007 
00008 Zone_States CheckEOL (int ZoneID, WORD* ADval) ;
00009 
00010 //*********************************************************************
00011 /**
00012 
00013  Determine if the EOL has been triggered. If so sends triggeres alarm once disarmed it will not set the alarm off again until armed again. 
00014  This is the hardwaare component to checking the zone status, mostly called by IsZoneTriggered()
00015  \todo ensure arm fails when EOL is triggered
00016  
00017  @param  ZoneID, the zone number to be checked
00018  @param WORD* ADval, outputs the analogue reading of the sensor, used for HTTPPrint
00019  @result Zone_States, the outcome of the checked zone sensor
00020  
00021  ********************************************************************/
00022 
00023 Zone_States CheckEOL (int ZoneID, WORD* ADval) {
00024         
00025         char AN0String[7];
00026         char DebugTemp[7];
00027         int PlexerDevice, BinaryValue;
00028         
00029         // Disable all analogue multiplexer
00030         PLEXERA_S_IO = 1; // High = disabled            
00031         PLEXERB_S_IO = 1;
00032         PLEXERC_S_IO = 1;
00033         
00034         // Select the analogue multiplexer
00035         PlexerDevice = ZoneID / 8;
00036         BinaryValue = ZoneID - ((ZoneID / 8) * 8); // The value can now be expressed as a 3 bit value
00037         
00038         
00039         if (PlexerDevice == 0) {
00040                 
00041                 PLEXERA_S_IO = 0; //enable this device
00042                 PLEXERA_2_IO = ((BinaryValue / 4 > 0)?TRUE:FALSE);
00043                 BinaryValue -= (BinaryValue / 4) * 4;           
00044                 PLEXERA_1_IO = ((BinaryValue / 2 > 0)?TRUE:FALSE);
00045                 BinaryValue -= (BinaryValue / 2) * 2;           
00046                 PLEXERA_0_IO = ((BinaryValue > 0)?TRUE:FALSE);
00047                 
00048         } // PlexerDevice ==0
00049         
00050         
00051         else if (PlexerDevice == 1) {
00052                 PLEXERB_S_IO = 0; //enable this device
00053                 PLEXERB_2_IO = BinaryValue / 4;
00054                 BinaryValue -= (BinaryValue / 4) * 4;
00055                 PLEXERB_1_IO = BinaryValue / 2;
00056                 BinaryValue -= (BinaryValue / 2) * 2;
00057                 PLEXERB_0_IO = BinaryValue;
00058         } // PlexerDevice == 1
00059         
00060         else if (PlexerDevice == 2) {
00061                 PLEXERC_S_IO = 0; //enable this device
00062                 PLEXERC_2_IO = BinaryValue / 4;
00063                 BinaryValue -= (BinaryValue / 4) * 4;
00064                 PLEXERC_1_IO = BinaryValue / 2;
00065                 BinaryValue -= (BinaryValue / 2) * 2;
00066                 PLEXERC_0_IO = BinaryValue;
00067         } // PlexerDevice == 2
00068         
00069         else {
00070 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00071                 putrsUART((ROM char*)" !!! CheckEOL is out of range !!!!! ");
00072 #endif
00073                 *ADval = 0;
00074                 return StateNormal;
00075         }
00076         
00077         
00078         
00079         //60 ns delay is required for the Multiplexer to swith analogue channels
00080         //Nop();Nop();Nop();Nop();Nop();
00081         
00082         // Select A/D channel AN4
00083         ADCON0 = 0b00010000;    // ADON = On(1), GO/DONE = Idle (0), AN4 selected (0100), not used (0), calibration off (0)
00084         ADCON0bits.ADON = 1;
00085     ADCON0bits.GO = 1;
00086         
00087     // Wait until A/D conversion is done
00088     while(ADCON0bits.GO);
00089         
00090     // Convert 10-bit value into ASCII string
00091     *ADval = (WORD)ADRES;
00092     uitoa(*ADval, AN0String);
00093         
00094         if (ZoneID == 1) {
00095                 memset(LCDText, '\0', 32);
00096                 if (strlen(AN0String) < (unsigned int)4 ) strcatpgm2ram(AN0String, (rom char *) " ");
00097                 if (strlen(AN0String) < (unsigned int)4 ) strcatpgm2ram(AN0String, (rom char *) " ");
00098                 if (strlen(AN0String) < (unsigned int)4 ) strcatpgm2ram(AN0String, (rom char *) " ");
00099                 
00100                 strcat(LCDText, AN0String);
00101                 strcatpgm2ram(LCDText, (rom char *) "->");
00102         }       
00103         
00104         if ( (*ADval >= (WORD)(EOLNORMAL - EOLTOLERANCE)) && (*ADval <= (WORD)(EOLNORMAL + EOLTOLERANCE))) {
00105                 if (ZoneID == 1) {
00106                         strcatpgm2ram(LCDText, (rom char *) "Normal");
00107                         LCDUpdate();
00108                 }       
00109                 // Need to consider if the zone is Normaly Open or Normaly Closed
00110                 if (ZoneConfig[ZoneID].IsNO == FALSE)
00111                         return StateNormal;
00112                 else
00113                         return StateTrigger;
00114         }
00115         
00116         else if ( (*ADval >= (WORD)(EOLTRIGGER - EOLTOLERANCE)) && (*ADval <= (WORD)(EOLTRIGGER + EOLTOLERANCE))) {
00117                 if (ZoneID == 1) {      
00118                         strcatpgm2ram(LCDText, (rom char *) "Trigger");
00119                         LCDUpdate();
00120                 }       
00121                 // Need to consider if the zone is Normaly Open or Normaly Closed
00122                 if (ZoneConfig[ZoneID].IsNO == FALSE)
00123                         return StateTrigger;
00124                 else
00125                         return StateNormal;
00126 
00127         }
00128         
00129         else {
00130                 
00131                 if (ZoneID == 1) {
00132                         strcatpgm2ram(LCDText, (rom char *) "Tamper");
00133                         LCDUpdate();
00134                 }       
00135                 return StateTamper;
00136         }       
00137         
00138         
00139     
00140         
00141 } // CheckEOL
00142 
00143 
00144 //*********************************************************************
00145 /**
00146  Determine if there has been a state change compared to the previously know state. Regular called to track the state of the zone.
00147  Updates the ZoneConfig and AreaConfig states (Triggered & Tampered). Include bounce timer to prevent zones from bouncing from one state to another
00148  and flooding the network all the time.
00149 
00150  @param  ZoneID, the zone being checked
00151  @result Zone_States, the outcome of the checked zone
00152  ********************************************************************/
00153 
00154 Zone_States IsZoneTriggered (int ZoneID)  { 
00155         
00156         
00157         Zone_States TheZoneState, PreviousZoneState;
00158         WORD Ignore;
00159         
00160         //ensure zone is not bypassed or isolated, if so return nothing
00161         if ((ZoneConfig[ZoneID].IsIsolated) || (ZoneConfig[ZoneID].IsBypassed)) 
00162                 return StateNothing;
00163         
00164         // What is the previous state
00165         if (ZoneConfig[ZoneID].IsTampered) PreviousZoneState = StateTamper;
00166         else if (ZoneConfig[ZoneID].IsTriggered) PreviousZoneState = StateTrigger;
00167         else PreviousZoneState = StateNormal;
00168         
00169         // Determine the state of the zone
00170         TheZoneState = CheckEOL(ZoneID, &Ignore);
00171         
00172         //If the state is the same as the previous check and bounce timer not active return nothing.
00173         if  ((PreviousZoneState == TheZoneState ) && (ZoneConfig[ZoneID].BounceDelay == (unsigned) 0))  
00174                 return StateNothing;
00175         
00176         // *** TAMPER ***
00177         
00178         // Zone is Tampered
00179         if (TheZoneState == StateTamper) {
00180                 ZoneConfig[ZoneID].IsTampered = TRUE;
00181                 ZoneConfig[ZoneID].BounceDelay = 0; // Will cause a loop always returning StateTamper if left out
00182                 
00183                 // find out what Areas the zone is a part of and set them to tampered
00184                 for(iCount = 0; iCount < AREACOUNT; iCount++) {
00185                         if (isZoneMemberOfArea(ZoneID, iCount)) {
00186                                 AreaConfig[iCount].IsTampered = TRUE;
00187 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00188                                 putrsUART((ROM char*)" Area ");
00189                                 uitoa(iCount, xPLMsgKey);
00190                                 putsUART(xPLMsgKey);
00191                                 putrsUART((ROM char*)" is Tampered. \r\n");
00192 #endif
00193                         }// isZoneMemberOfArea(ZoneID, iCount)
00194                 }// iCount      
00195                 return StateTamper;
00196         } // StateTamper
00197         
00198         
00199         // Return from Tamper
00200         if (PreviousZoneState == StateTamper) {
00201                 ZoneConfig[ZoneID].IsTampered = FALSE;
00202                 ZoneConfig[ZoneID].BounceDelay = 0; 
00203                 
00204                 // find out what Areas the zone is a part and set tamper to false if no other zones in the area are tampered
00205                 for(iCount = 0; iCount < AREACOUNT; iCount++) {
00206                         if (isZoneMemberOfArea(ZoneID, iCount)) {
00207                                 for(i2Count=0; i2Count < ZONECOUNT; i2Count++) {
00208                                         if ((i2Count != ZoneID) && isZoneMemberOfArea(i2Count, iCount)) {
00209                                                 if( ZoneConfig[i2Count].IsTampered == TRUE) {
00210                                                         i2Count = 1;
00211                                                         break;
00212                                                 }// is triggered
00213                                         }// is member of the zone                
00214                                 }//i2Count, Area in question
00215                                 if (i2Count >= ZONECOUNT) { // no zones in the area found to be triggered
00216                                         AreaConfig[iCount].IsTampered = FALSE;  
00217 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00218                                         putrsUART((ROM char*)" Area ");
00219                                         uitoa(iCount, xPLMsgKey);
00220                                         putsUART(xPLMsgKey);
00221                                         putrsUART((ROM char*)" is not tampered. \r\n");
00222 #endif
00223                                 }// i2Count >= ZONECOUNT        
00224                         }// isZoneMemberOfArea(ZoneID, iCount)
00225                 }// iCount              
00226                 
00227                 // When changing from Tampered to Triggered this will generate a Triggered event after the tamper cleared event
00228                 ZoneConfig[ZoneID].IsTriggered = FALSE;
00229                 // Return as normal even if triggered to ensure message sequence is correct
00230                 return StateNormal;
00231                 
00232         }       
00233         
00234         
00235         // *** BOUNCE / TRIGGER CLEARED ***
00236         
00237         //Every time we return from Triggered to Normal there is a delay of .5 Second, this limits bouncing speed.
00238         //If BounceTimer not expired return Nothing. If we are bouncing it will only send 2 msg per 1/2 second. Do not change previous state 
00239         if (ZoneConfig[ZoneID].BounceDelay > (unsigned) 1) {
00240                 ZoneConfig[ZoneID].BounceDelay--;
00241                 if (TheZoneState == StateTrigger)
00242                         ZoneConfig[ZoneID].BounceDelay = 0;     
00243                 return StateNothing;
00244         }        
00245         
00246         //if BounceTimer is expired clear BounceTimer
00247         if (ZoneConfig[ZoneID].BounceDelay == (unsigned) 1) {
00248                 
00249                 // if state = Trigger then return nothing as we have bounced back (Trigger, Normal Trigger)
00250                 if (TheZoneState == StateTrigger) {
00251                         ZoneConfig[ZoneID].BounceDelay = 0;
00252 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00253                         putrsUART((ROM char*)" Bounce prevented. Zone ");
00254                         uitoa(ZoneID, xPLMsgKey);
00255                         putsUART(xPLMsgKey);
00256                         putrsUART((ROM char*)" remains triggered.\r\n");
00257 #endif
00258                         return StateNothing;
00259                 }
00260                 
00261                 // if state = normal return Normal and set the state flag on the zone
00262                 if (TheZoneState == StateNormal) {
00263                         ZoneConfig[ZoneID].BounceDelay = 0;
00264                         ZoneConfig[ZoneID].IsTriggered = FALSE;
00265                         ZoneConfig[ZoneID].IsTampered = FALSE;
00266                         
00267 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00268                         putrsUART((ROM char*)" Bounce Cleared. Zone ");
00269                         uitoa(ZoneID, xPLMsgKey);
00270                         putsUART(xPLMsgKey);
00271                         putrsUART((ROM char*)" is normal. \r\n");
00272 #endif
00273                         
00274                         // find out what Areas the zone is a part and set triggered to false if no other zones in the area
00275                         // are also triggered at the same time
00276                         for(iCount = 0; iCount < AREACOUNT; iCount++) {
00277                                 if (isZoneMemberOfArea(ZoneID, iCount)) {
00278                                         for(i2Count=0; i2Count < ZONECOUNT; i2Count++) {
00279                                                 if ((i2Count != ZoneID) && isZoneMemberOfArea(i2Count, iCount)) {
00280                                                         if( ZoneConfig[i2Count].IsTriggered == TRUE) {
00281                                                                 i2Count = 1;
00282                                                                 break;
00283                                                         }// is triggered
00284                                                 }// is member of the zone                
00285                                         }//i2Count, Area in question
00286                                         if (i2Count >= ZONECOUNT) { // no zones in the area found to be triggered
00287                                                 AreaConfig[iCount].IsTriggered = FALSE; 
00288 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00289                                                 putrsUART((ROM char*)" Area ");
00290                                                 uitoa(iCount, xPLMsgKey);
00291                                                 putsUART(xPLMsgKey);
00292                                                 putrsUART((ROM char*)" is normal. \r\n");
00293 #endif
00294                                         }// i2Count >= ZONECOUNT        
00295                                 }// isZoneMemberOfArea(ZoneID, iCount)
00296                         }// iCount              
00297                         
00298                         return StateNormal;
00299                 }
00300         }       
00301         
00302         
00303         //If current state Normal, set the BounceTimer, return Nothing
00304         if (TheZoneState == StateNormal) {
00305                 ZoneConfig[ZoneID].BounceDelay = BOUNCEDELAY;
00306 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00307                 if (ZoneID == 0) putrsUART((ROM char*)" Bounce Set. \r\n");
00308 #endif
00309                 return StateNothing;
00310         }
00311         
00312         // *** TRIGGER ***
00313         
00314         //The only thing left should be a normal trigger, return trigger and set the state flag on the zone
00315         if (TheZoneState == StateTrigger) {
00316                 ZoneConfig[ZoneID].BounceDelay = 0;
00317                 ZoneConfig[ZoneID].IsTriggered = TRUE;
00318                 
00319 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00320                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"Zone ");
00321                 uitoa(ZoneID, xPLMsgKey);
00322                 putsUART(xPLMsgKey);
00323                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"triggered. ");
00324 #endif
00325                 
00326                 // find out what Areas the zone is a part of and set them to triggered
00327                 for(iCount = 0; iCount < AREACOUNT; iCount++) {
00328                         if (isZoneMemberOfArea(ZoneID, iCount)) {
00329                                 AreaConfig[iCount].IsTriggered = TRUE;
00330 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00331                                 putrsUART((ROM char*)" Area ");
00332                                 uitoa(iCount, xPLMsgKey);
00333                                 putsUART(xPLMsgKey);
00334                                 putrsUART((ROM char*)" is Triggered. \r\n");
00335 #endif
00336                         }// isZoneMemberOfArea(ZoneID, iCount)
00337                 }// iCount      
00338                 
00339                 return StateTrigger;
00340         }       
00341         
00342 } //IsZoneTriggered
00343 
00344 //******************************************************************************
00345 /// Prints the analogue value read from the zone, calls CheckEOL() to determine the value
00346 void HTTPPrint_EOLValue (WORD num) {
00347         
00348         char EOLOutput[5];
00349         Zone_States Ignore;
00350         WORD EOLValue;
00351         
00352         // Set a flag to indicate not finished
00353         curHTTP.callbackPos = 1;
00354         
00355         // Make sure there's enough output space
00356         if(TCPIsPutReady(sktHTTP) < (unsigned int)5)
00357                 return;
00358         
00359         Ignore = CheckEOL(num, &EOLValue);
00360         uitoa(EOLValue, EOLOutput);
00361         
00362         TCPPutArray(sktHTTP, (BYTE*)EOLOutput, (WORD) strlen(EOLOutput));
00363         
00364         // Indicate that we're done
00365         curHTTP.callbackPos = 0x00;
00366         return;
00367         
00368 }
